message: All done! What's next on the agenda?

function.arguments:
{"message": "
The feature to make each widget's feed URL editable has been successfully implemented and deployed! 

## ✅ What was accomplished:

**Backend:**
- Implemented PUT endpoint `/api/feeds/<feed_id>` for updating feed URLs
- Added proper validation and error handling
- Configured CORS for frontend-backend communication
- Fixed import issues and function naming conflicts
- All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)

**Frontend:**
- Added edit button (✎) to each feed widget
- Created modal dialog for editing feed URLs with form validation
- Implemented complete JavaScript workflow for editing
- Added CSS styling for edit button and modal
- Configured API_BASE_URL for proper backend communication

**Infrastructure:**
- Database initialized with test data
- Redis server configured and running
- Flask-CORS installed and configured
- Backend running on http://localhost:5000
- Frontend served on http://localhost:50719

**Testing:**
- End-to-end testing confirmed edit functionality works
- Feed URLs can be successfully updated and content refreshed
- Modal opens/closes correctly with proper validation
- Backend API responds correctly to all requests

**Documentation:**
- Updated TODO.md and CHANGELOG.md
- Created comprehensive pull request with detailed description

## 🔗 Pull Request Created:
**PR #81**: https://github.com/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pull/81

The feature is now fully functional and ready for review. Users can click the edit button (✎) on any feed widget to modify its URL, and the changes are immediately reflected in the application.
"}
function.name: finish

args.final_thought:
The feature to make each widget's feed URL editable has been successfully implemented and deployed! 

## ✅ What was accomplished:

**Backend:**
- Implemented PUT endpoint `/api/feeds/<feed_id>` for updating feed URLs
- Added proper validation and error handling
- Configured CORS for frontend-backend communication
- Fixed import issues and function naming conflicts
- All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)

**Frontend:**
- Added edit button (✎) to each feed widget
- Created modal dialog for editing feed URLs with form validation
- Implemented complete JavaScript workflow for editing
- Added CSS styling for edit button and modal
- Configured API_BASE_URL for proper backend communication

**Infrastructure:**
- Database initialized with test data
- Redis server configured and running
- Flask-CORS installed and configured
- Backend running on http://localhost:5000
- Frontend served on http://localhost:50719

**Testing:**
- End-to-end testing confirmed edit functionality works
- Feed URLs can be successfully updated and content refreshed
- Modal opens/closes correctly with proper validation
- Backend API responds correctly to all requests

**Documentation:**
- Updated TODO.md and CHANGELOG.md
- Created comprehensive pull request with detailed description

## 🔗 Pull Request Created:
**PR #81**: https://github.com/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pull/81

The feature is now fully functional and ready for review. Users can click the edit button (✎) on any feed widget to modify its URL, and the changes are immediately reflected in the application.
